PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: coordinated efforts have been made to help turn around overall economic performance, enhance the endogenous growth dynamics of the economy, improve social expectations, and defuse potential risks in a sustained way, thereby setting the stage for building a modern socialist country in all respects.\n                "}]

When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the rmb exchange rate regime will be further improved to keep.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",

financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: by promoting the balance between internal and external equilibria, and coordinating financial support for the real economy and risk prevention, the pbc will ensure the national economy performs within a reasonable range, promote high-quality economic development, and thereby stand ready for the convening of the 20th cpc national congress.\n                "}]

Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it was put forward on the meeting that, according to the overall arrangements of the state council, continued efforts would be made to implement a relatively easy monetary policy and strike a balance between maintaining stable and fairly rapid economic development, restructuring and managing inflation expectations.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence mentions implementing a 'relatively easy monetary policy', which suggests a dovish stance as it implies a more accommodative approach to monetary policy."
}

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: efforts will be made to guide financial institutions to optimize their credit structure, prevent financial risks and improve their financial services to better serve the real economy and ensure a stable and relatively fast economy growth.\n                "}]

to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: monetary policy instruments should be adoptedto timely and moderately manage the financial system liquidity while avoiding majorfluctuation.\n                "}]
2025-05-04 01:20:01,823 - together_inference - INFO - Response: {
"label": "neutral",
"justification": "The sentence emphasizes the need to manage liquidity in a timely and moderate manner, without taking a specific stance on tightening or loosening monetary policy."
}

policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the committee concluded that,the macro-economic control has achieved preliminary results and variousadjustment measures would continue to take effect.\n                "}]

  \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: renminbiexchange rate shall be maintained basically stable at an adaptive and equilibriumlevel to promote the balance of international payments.\n                "}]

Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: while the loan prime rate (lpr) reform continued to unleash its benefits, the monetary policy transmission has become more efficient, and the lending rates have remained stable with a slight decline.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence indicates that the loan prime rate reform has led to more efficient monetary policy transmission and a slight decline in lending rates, which suggests a relaxation of monetary policy."
}

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: foreign exchange management system reform should be deepenedto promote a basic equilibrium of the balance of payments.\n                "}]

Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it was emphasized at the meeting that it was necessary to follow the latest domestic and international economic and financial developments and their impacts, continue the implementation of a prudent monetary policy, maintain policy stability and consistency, make macro-management policies better-targeted, more flexible and forward-looking, properly handle the intensity, pace and focus of policy implementation, conduct fine-tunings and take preemptive measures in a timely manner in view of changing situations, strike a balance among stable and relatively fast economic growth, economic structural adjustment and inflation expectation management, and strengthen systemic risk prevention.\n                "}]

the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it was noted at the meeting that since the beginning of 2023, the pboc has sought progress while giving top priority to the stability of macro policies, implemented a sound monetary policy in a targeted and effective manner, strengthened the counter-cyclical and inter-temporal adjustments, and used\xa0a mix of policy tools, such as interest rates, the required reserve ratio (rrr) and central bank lending, thereby providing effective support for the real economy, effectively forestalling\xa0financial risks, and creating\xa0a sound monetary and financial environment for economic recovery.\n                "}]

may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: weighing themonetary policy stance and measures for the coming periods, the committee heldthe view that a tight monetary policy should be implemented by taking variousmeasures in line with the guidance of the central economic work conference.efforts should be made to strengthen liquidity management by taking effectivemeasures, improve guidance on financial institutions, restrain the excessivegrowth of money and credit and further improve credit structure to ensurecredit support to agricultural economy, increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the pboc will continue its efforts and ride on the momentum to intensify macro adjustments, implement a sound monetary may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: as\xa0the expectations remain stable, the rmb exchange rate has become more flexible in two-way fluctuations PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it was emphasized at the meeting that the pbc will follow the guidance of xi jinping’s thought on socialism with chinese characteristics for a new era, earnestly implement the guidelines of the fourth plenary session of the 19th cpc central committee, the central economic work conference and the report on the work of the government, continue acting in accordance with the decisions and arrangements made by the cpc central committee and the state council, stick to the goal of building a moderately prosperous society in all respects, coordinate pandemic containment efforts with economic and social development, and adhere to the underlying principle of pursuing progress while ensuring stability with the pandemic containment becoming a normal.\n                "}]

increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it will\xa0consolidate and expand achievements in pandemic containment and economic and social development, while\xa0ensuring\xa0stability on six fronts, namely, employment, the financial sector, foreign trade, foreign investment, domestic investment,\xa0and\xa0market\xa0expectations, and maintaining\xa0security in six areas, namely, employment, the people’s basic livelihood, the operations of market entities, food and energy, stable industrial and supply chains, as well as the normal functioning of primary-level governments.\n                "}]

financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: furthermore, inflationary pressures are also building up andasset prices are rising persistently.\n                "}]

PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the monetary policy committee of the pbc convened its second quarterly meeting in 2012 in beijing days ago.\n You are also given an annotation guide for the feature: stance.\n            Strictly follow the guide; do not invent new criteria or labels.\n\n            Your task is to classify whether it is "hawkish", "neutral", "dovish", or "irrelevant" and briefly justify your choice.\n            \n            Instructions:\n            1. Assign one of the following labels under the `label` key:\n            "hawkish", "neutral", "dovish", or "irrelevant"\n            \n            2. Provide a concise explanation for your classification using the `justification` key. Limit the justification to one sentence.\n            \n            3. Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it will concentrate on running its own affairs well and delivering good cross-cycle policy designs, so as to bolster high-quality economic development.\n                "}]

"label": "Dovish",
"justification": "The sentence implies that the PBoC is focused on promoting high-quality economic development, which suggests a dovish stance."
}

remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: efforts will be made to improve the coordination, transmission and implementation mechanisms for fiscal, monetary and employment policies, so as to effectively offset the impact of the pandemic on economic growth.\n                "}]

"label": "dovish",
"justification": "The sentence implies that the PBoC is taking measures to promote economic growth, which is a dovish stance."

changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the   \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of China}} \\label{tb:pboc_mp_stance_guide}\\\\\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: the prudent monetary policy shall be more properly managed to keep liquidity at reasonably ample levels, and keep the reasonable growth of money supply, credit and aggregate financing to the real economy.\n                "}]

"label": "neutral",
"justification": "The sentence emphasizes maintaining liquidity at reasonably ample levels and promoting reasonable growth of money supply, credit, and aggregate financing, indicating a balanced approach."
}

Your output must follow this structure:\n            {\n            "label": "hawkish | dovish | neutral | irrelevant",\n            "justification": "One-sentence explanation for the assigned label"\n            }'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "Input:\n\n                ### Annotation Guide: \\mptext{pboc}{seven} Inflation, Value of the Yuan, Interest Rates, Money Supply, GDP Growth Rate, and Trade Output.\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item \\textit{Inflation: }A sentence about the inflation rate in the country\n    \\item \\textit{Value of the Yuan: }A sentence about how the value of the Yuan is changing relative to the USD \n    \\item \\textit{Interest Rates: }A sentence about how interest rates, including the repo rate and loan prime rates are changing. \n    \\item \\textit{Money Supply: }A sentence pertaining the M2 money supply. PCB may conduct short-term liquidity operations and reverse repo operations to influence liquidity into the market.\n    \\item \\textit{GDP Growth Rate: }A sentence pertaining to changes in GDP or changes in the commodities market or key industry that may impact the GDP\n    \\item \\textit{Trade Output: }A sentence pertaining to China's export or import levels or how macroeconomic factors   may impact foreign trade \n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\textbf{Examples:}\n\\begin{itemize}\n    \\item ``In line with the rules on monetary policy committee of the people's bank of china and with the approval of the state council, presidents of two wholly state-owned commercial banks, Liu Mingkang, Zhang Enzhao and Wu Jinglian will withdraw from the monetary policy committee as their term has expired.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Irrelevant:} Sentence is not directly related to monetary policy. \n    \\item ``Improvement of the managed floating exchange rate regime should be effected, continuously following the principle of “making it a self-initiated, controllable and gradual process.''''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Dovish: } The PBoC is confident in the health of the market is not concerned about the money supply becoming too large hence their sire to focus on floating the exchange rate.\n    \\item ``It was noted at the meeting that efforts should made to implement the prudent monetary policy, make the financial measures more targeted, flexible and effective, and give more priority to stabilizing the general price level in 2011.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Hawkish: }The PBoC feels that monetary policy needs to be implemented in order to stabilize prices, which is dovish. \n    \\item ``The committee discussed monetary policy and measures to be adopted in the period ahead and concurred that the sound monetary policy should be preserved, interest rates of deposits and loans be maintained stable to ensure steady advancement of market-based interest rate reform.''\n    \\newline\\textbf{Neutral: }The PBoC is emphasizing maintaining the currency policy.\n\n\\end{itemize}\n\n\\newpage\n\n\\begin{longtable}{p{0.118\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}p{0.183\\textwidth}}\n\\caption{\\mptitle{People's Bank of \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endfirsthead\n\n\\toprule\n\\textbf{Category} & \\textbf{Hawkish} & \\textbf{Dovish} & \\textbf{Neutral} & \\textbf{Irrelevant} \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\endhead\n\\textbf{Inflation} & When inflation rates rise inflationary pressures. & When inflation rates fall. & When inflation rate is stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Value of the Yuan} & When Yuan depreciates. & When Yuan appreciates. & When Yuan remains stable. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Interest Rates} & When the repo rate increases or loan prime rates (LPR) are increased. & When repo rate decreases or when short-term rates are lowered. & When interest rates are maintained at the same level. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Money Supply} & When M2 money supply is decreasing. & When PBC restricts money supply. & When money supply remains the same. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{GDP Growth Rate} & When GDP growth declines. & When GDP growth increases or when measures will be taken to promote real economic growth. & When GDP growth remains constant. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\midrule\n\\textbf{Trade Output} & When policy aims to decreasing foreign trade. & When there are bottlenecks key industries namely oil, coal, and electricity, or sluggish global economy, or other hindrances to foreign trade. & When there is a focus on maintaining stability in trade. & Sentence is not relevant to monetary policy. \\\\\n\\bottomrule\n\\end{longtable}\n\n\n\n                ### Sentence: it will\xa0work on\xa0developing\xa0tools to support carbon emissions\xa0reduction, and\xa0improve\xa0the green finance system for the goals of achieving peak carbon emissions and carbon neutrality.\n                "}]
